The Singapore-Cambridge General Certificate of Education Ordinary Level (O-level) examination is a national examination held annually in Singapore. The examinations are jointly conducted by the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES), Singapore Ministry of Education (MOE) as well as the Singapore Examinations and Assessment Board (SEAB).[1]

Despite the engagement of an identical examination board as partnering authority, the Singapore-Cambridge GCE Ordinary Level examination have no relation to the British GCSE examinations, having de-linked since 2006 when the Singapore Ministry of Education (MOE) took over the management of the national examination.

quote.msg: 其實日本大學又點? 見日本包辦左大半科學方面嘅亞洲人諾貝爾獎得主, 但除左東大外其他玩呢d排名遊戲似乎都一般, 而且東大都好似只係排廿幾輸埋比北大

認真答
1) 日本人對自己既語言非常有自豪感，唔中意寫英文論文，導致外國冇人引用

2) 日本人對於先進既科技，保密功夫通常做得一流。商業上既技術，一般已經落後科研/軍用技術，不過大部份日本公司，仍然會將商品既核心技術收得好埋 (真係要搵食㗎嘛大佬)

3) 部份科研涉及軍事用途。因此R&D Center, 廠房會刻意設係偏遠鄉間，冇門牌，令你搵唔到(歷史/戰爭原因)。研究成果更加唔會公開。

歡迎各路英雄補充
